intro: Achimenes panamensis, commonly known as the Panama bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Achimenes panamensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
